Question 52) Cassava processing was an activity already performed by the natives living in Brazil before the arrival of Portuguese and Africans. However, throughout the Portuguese colonization process, the production of flour has been perfected and expanded, becoming commonplace throughout the territory of the Portuguese colony in America. With the consolidation of the Atlantic trade in its different connections, flour crossed the seas and reached the African markets.
BEZERRA, N. R. Slavery, flour and Atlantic trafficking: a new look at the relations between Rio de Janeiro and considering the formation of the Atlantic space, this product historically exemplifies to
A) Diffusion of eating habits.
B) dissemination of festive rituals.
C) expansion of indigenous knowledge.
D) appropriation of warrior customs.
E) diversification of religious offerings.
